intro: Tinomiscium elasticum, commonly known as the elastic mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and gelatinous, sticky berries. The plant's leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to retain moisture in its often-dry habitat. It produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by its distinctive, elastic fruits. Tinomiscium elasticum is found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
